textBox.richText: Finally, enough snow has melted to get the dirt bike out and ride! Matt, Steve, and I went to 5 Mile Pass for a few hours of afternoon riding. The temperature was in the low 60’s and the sky was blue--perfect riding weather! I’m including a few pictures below: Mine tailing After going up Rattlesnake Canyon we headed up Constrictor Canyon, the most interesting feature of which is this 6-7 foot waterfall that jeepers love to try and go up. We stopped before this point and walked the last little bit to show Matt, and to scope out a way around for a future attempt. Just above where we left the bikes was this old mine carved into the side of the canyon. Matt Steve Greg View from the trail--there are still patches of snow on some of the north-facing slopes. Matt Another view from the trail, looking to the south. And looking east toward the back of Lake Mountain, which is located on the west side of Utah Lake. Bottom line: it was great to get back out on the bike!
